|blank1_name = |blank1_info = |footnotes = }} 'Scottsdale' (O'odham Vaá¹£ai S-
vaá¹£onÄ­; Yaqui Eskatel) is a city in the eastern part of Maricopa County,
Arizona, United States, adjacent to Phoenix. According to the U.S. Census
Bureau, as of 2010 the population of the city was 217,385. The 2013 Population
is estimated to be of about 221,789 people living within the city. [[The New York Times]] described downtown Scottsdale as "a
desert version of Miami's South Beach" and as having "plenty of late night
partying and a buzzing hotel scene".

Scottsdale is bordered to the west by Phoenix and Paradise Valley, to the north
by Carefree, to the south by Tempe, and to the east by Fountain Hills and the
Salt River Pima-Maricopa Indian Community.
